Pre-Game Insights: Guinea comes into the match with a positive recent record, winning three of their last five games and drawing one, with only one loss.
Senegal are in excellent form, winning four and drawing one of their last five games, conceding just one goal in the process.
The match is scheduled to kick off on Tuesday, 23 January 2024, at 05:00 PM GMT (10:30 PM IST) at Charles Konan Banny Stadium.
Mohamed Bayo is set to lead Guinea’s frontline for the third consecutive game.
Ismaila Sarr has already made a significant impact with three goal contributions in the tournament’s initial two games.
Guinea will face the absence of their captain, Francois Kamano, who received a straight red card in the 1-1 draw against Cameroon in the initial game.
Senegal may continue to be without defender Moussa Niakhite, who missed the second game due to an injury sustained in the first.
Midfielder Lamine Camara and striker Habib Diallo could potentially be absent after sustaining injuries in the 3-1 victory over Cameroon in the last match.
Nicolas Jackson may earn his first tournament start in the forward position, and veteran Idrissa Gueye could be included in the starting XI to compensate for the team’s injuries.
Senegal are a better team when these two sides meet, their clashes have been closely contested, with none producing more than a single deciding goal.
Despite the anticipated tight encounter, Senegal possesses the quality to clinch a narrow victory.
